item.title: Meta 再次重组人工智能部门，追求超级智能
item.description: Meta Platforms 公司正在将其新成立的人工智能部门拆分为四个不同的团队，并重新分配公司现有的许多人工智能员工，试图更好地利用最近收购的价值数十亿美元的人才。【原文：Meta Platforms Inc. is splitting its newly formed artificial intelligence group into four distinct teams and reassigning many of the company’s existing AI employees, an attempt to better capitalize on billions of dollars’ worth of recently acquired talent.】

item.title: 经济学家称，瑞士央行不应试图缓解美国关税影响
item.description: 一组经济学家表示，瑞士国家银行不应寻求通过货币政策渠道来缓和美国大幅关税的影响。【原文：The Swiss National Bank shouldn’t seek to soften the impact of steep US tariffs through monetary-policy channels, according to a group of economists.】

item.title: 韩国下令审查西屋公司核电协议
item.description: 在当地媒体报道了与美国西屋电气公司（Westinghouse Electric Co.【原文：South Korea will review an agreement with Westinghouse Electric Co. to resolve a nuclear power intellectual property dispute after local media reported the deal’s potentially unfavorable terms.】

item.title: 中国的反革命运动看似轰轰烈烈
item.description: 大家好，欢迎收看《奇货可居》时事通讯，这里每天都有来自《奇货可居》的精彩内容。有时是我们乔-韦森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）为您带来我们对市场、金融和经济最新发展的看法。有时是我们的专家嘉宾和消息来源网络提供的内容。不管是什么，我们保证永远有趣。【原文：Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. Sometimes it's us, Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway, bringing you our thoughts on the most recent developments in markets, finance and the economy. And sometimes it's contributions from our network of expert guests and sources. Whatever it is, we promise it will always be interesting.】

item.title: 以色列批准增加预算以支付持续的战争费用
item.description: 以色列总理本雅明-内塔尼亚胡（Benjamin Netanyahu）的内阁批准增加今年的国家预算，以支付因 6 月与伊朗的 12 天战争和加沙的持续战斗而产生的额外开支。【原文：Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s cabinet approved an increase to this year’s state budget to cover additional spending incurred by the 12-day war with Iran in June and ongoing fighting in Gaza.】

item.title: 普利兹克私人资本公司融资 34 亿美元
item.description: 由亿万富翁、伊利诺伊州州长 JB-普利兹克及其兄弟托尼创办的投资公司普利兹克私人资本公司（Pritzker Private Capital），为其第四个基金筹集了创纪录的 34 亿美元。【原文：Pritzker Private Capital, the investment firm started by billionaire Illinois Governor JB Pritzker and his brother, Tony, raised a record $3.4 billion for its fourth fund.】

item.title: 津巴布韦中央银行停电导致银行支付中断
item.description: 津巴布韦银行报告称，在中央银行出现网络问题后，一种广泛使用的支付渠道普遍中断，该银行正在努力修复这一问题。【原文：Zimbabwean banks reported widespread disruption to a widely-used payment channel, after the central bank experienced a network problem that it is trying to fix.】

item.title: 调查显示，拥有 6170 亿美元资金的基金不再看空中国
item.description: 汇丰控股公司（HSBC Holdings Plc）的一项调查显示，在长达四个月的涨势中，资金经理们正在缩减对中国的看空立场，并将科技股和消费股纳入他们的投资组合。【原文：Money managers are scaling back their bearish stance on China, adding technology and consumer stocks to their portfolios amid a four-month-long rally, according to an HSBC Holdings Plc survey.】

item.title: S&P称美国养老金将借助股市反弹实现12%的收益
item.description: S&P 全球评级公司（S&P Global Ratings）在最近的一份报告中说，美国公共退休基金将从强劲的股票回报中获利，其表现将超过一般投资预期。【原文：US public retirement funds will outperform typical investment expectations as they profit from strong stock returns, S&P Global Ratings said in a recent report.】

item.title: 贝森特称印度最富有的家族受益于与俄罗斯的交易
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）声称，一些 "印度最富有的家庭 "从购买俄罗斯原油中获益，同时重申了对这个南亚国家提高关税的计划。【原文：US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent claimed some of the “richest families in India” benefited from the purchase of Russian crude oil, while reiterating plans to boost tariffs on the South Asian nation.】

item.title: 谷歌为躲避欧盟罚款对 Play 商店进行全面改造
item.description: 在监管机构发出警告后，Alphabet 公司旗下的谷歌公司对其 Play 商店进行了修改，以避免未来受到欧盟的处罚。【原文：Alphabet Inc.’s Google has pitched changes to its Play Store in a bid to ward off future European Union penalties following a warning from regulators.】

item.title: 怀俄明州成为首个推出国家发行的稳定币的州
item.description: 怀俄明州推出了承诺已久的稳定币，旨在为消费者和企业提供即时交易并降低费用，这是牛仔之州吸引数字资产企业的最新努力。【原文：Wyoming launched its long-promised stablecoin, designed to offer instant transactions and reduced fees for consumers and businesses, in the latest effort by the Cowboy State to attract digital asset businesses.】

item.title: 鲍曼重点谈她目前在美联储的角色，包括规则改革
item.description: 美国联邦储备委员会理事米歇尔-鲍曼（Michelle Bowman）表示，她将继续专注于现有的监管组合，包括彻底改革大银行资本规则和杜绝所谓的去银行化（debanking）的计划。【原文：US Federal Reserve Governor Michelle Bowman said she’s keeping her focus on the regulatory portfolio she has now, including plans to overhaul big-bank capital rules and to stamp out so-called debanking.】

item.title: 特朗普关税缓期执行后，美国铜企仍在涨价
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）出人意料地决定对最基本的铜进口商品免征关税，仅仅几周之后，美国主要的电线生产商就提高了价格，这表明即使金属价格暴跌，美国消费者最终也可能要支付更高的价格。【原文：Major US producers of electrical wire are raising prices just weeks after a surprise decision by President Donald Trump to exempt the most basic copper imports from tariffs, suggesting that American consumers may end up paying more even after metal prices plunged.】

item.title: 土耳其亿万富翁达成 4.65 亿美元的必和必拓巴西矿业交易
item.description: CoreX Holding BV 同意以高达 4.65 亿美元的价格收购矿业巨头必和必拓集团（BHP Group Ltd）在巴西的 Carajas 铜矿，这是土耳其亿万富翁罗伯特-尤克塞尔-耶尔德里姆（Robert Yuksel Yildirim）推动建立独立于中国的金属供应链的最大一笔交易。【原文：CoreX Holding BV agreed to buy mining giant BHP Group Ltd’s Carajas copper mines in Brazil for as much as $465 million, the biggest deal yet in Turkish billionaire Robert Yuksel Yildirim’s push to build a metals supply chain independent of China.】

item.title: 英特尔首席执行官获得软银和特朗普的复兴支持
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普要求英特尔公司首席执行官陈立武下台不到两周后，该公司首席执行官有机会获得数十亿美元的新资金，这将有助于他扭转这家陷入困境的美国芯片制造商的局面。【原文：Less than two weeks after President Donald Trump called for the ouster of Intel Corp.’s Lip-Bu Tan, the company’s chief executive officer has a shot at securing billions of dollars in fresh capital that could help him turn around the troubled US chipmaker.】

item.title: 谷歌是否会被分拆？即将到来的反垄断裁决中的利害关系
item.description: 2024 年，美国一名法官认定谷歌非法垄断了搜索市场，Alphabet 公司旗下的谷歌公司在这一最大的反垄断挑战中败下阵来。现在，谷歌面临的可能是公司被迫解体。【原文：Alphabet Inc.’s Google lost the biggest antitrust challenge it has confronted when a US judge in 2024 found that it illegally monopolized the search market. Now it’s facing the possibility that the result will be a forced breakup of the company.】

item.title: 金融业寻求全面修订全球银行加密货币规则
item.description: 全球主要的金融游说团体呼吁监管机构暂停即将实施的监管银行加密货币交易的严格新标准，并重新审视他们认为过于繁琐的措施。【原文：The world’s major financial lobbying groups called on regulators to pause the upcoming implementation of tough new standards governing banks’ cryptocurrency dealings and revisit measures they argue are needlessly onerous.】

item.title: 股票反弹为阿曼的 IPO 雄心注入活力
item.description: 近几个月来，阿曼股市卷土重来，在经历了一连串不尽如人意的首演之后，投资者对这个海湾国家的私有化计划抱有更高的期望。【原文：Oman’s stock market has staged a comeback in recent months, raising investor expectations for the Gulf state’s privatization program after a string of underwhelming debuts.】

item.title: 乌克兰电信公司 Kyivstar 因特朗普推动和平而扩大涨幅
item.description: 乌克兰最大的移动运营商 Kyivstar Group Ltd. 与一家空头公司合并后在美国上市，该公司股价在上市后的第三个交易日跳涨 22%。【原文：Shares of Kyivstar Group Ltd., Ukraine’s largest mobile operator, jump as much as 22% in their third trading session since the company went public in the US by merging with a blank-check firm.】

item.title: 投资者分析零售业收益，等待鲍威尔讲话，美国股市下跌
item.description: 美国股市周二开盘下跌，原因是家得宝公司（Home Depot Inc.【原文：US equities fell at the open Tuesday as earnings from Home Depot Inc. kicked off a string of key retail reports and as investors awaited a Federal Reserve symposium this week to set expectations for the path of interest rates.】

item.title: 特朗普加征关税后，莱索托转向亚洲和其他市场
item.description: 在生产商受到美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）新关税制度不确定性的打击后，莱索托正在为其纺织品争取亚洲和其他地区的买家，并已从邻国南非获得了新业务。【原文：Lesotho is courting buyers in Asia and elsewhere for its textiles after producers were battered by the uncertainty surrounding US President Donald Trump’s new tariff regime and has already secured new business from neighboring South Africa.】

item.title: 中国 DeepSeek 发布 V3.1，提升人工智能模型能力
item.description: DeepSeek 周二宣布对其较旧的 V3 人工智能模型进行更新，宣布增强版已准备好进行测试。【原文：DeepSeek announced what appeared to be an update to its older V3 artificial intelligence model on Tuesday, declaring an enhanced version ready for testing.】

item.title: Pimco 如何战胜 Apollo 和 KKR，赢得 290 亿美元的 Meta 交易
item.description: 摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）在 7 月份与全球最大的四家资产管理公司接触时，得到了一个不同寻常的信息：他们已经进入了迄今为止最炙手可热的私人信贷交易的最后一轮。但是，如果他们想到达终点，就需要结成对子。【原文：Morgan Stanley had an unusual message when it approached four of the world’s biggest asset managers in July: they had progressed to the final round of one of the most sought-after private credit deals to date. But if they wanted to get to the finish line, they would need to pair up.】

item.title: 图洛石油公司与债券持有人讨论即将到期的债务问题
item.description: 图洛石油公司（Tullow Oil Plc）正在与其债券持有人就明年到期的近13亿美元债券的再融资问题进行谈判，即将到期的债券增加了这家专注于非洲的石油勘探公司的压力。【原文：Tullow Oil Plc is in talks with its bondholders about refinancing a nearly $1.3 billion bond due next year, as the imminent maturity adds to pressure on the Africa-focused oil explorer.】

item.title: Circle 赌上自己的区块链，向支付巨头发起挑战
item.description: 今年夏天，Circle Internet Group Inc.上市，这标志着一个里程碑：稳定币--曾经的小众加密工具--正在步入金融主流，而其与美元挂钩的代币 USDC 则巩固了自己作为数字资产基础设施基石的地位。【原文：When Circle Internet Group Inc. went public this summer, it marked a milestone: stablecoins — once a niche crypto utility — were stepping into the financial mainstream and USDC, its dollar-pegged token, cemented itself as a cornerstone of digital-asset infrastructure.】

item.title: 伊朗因高温将在长周末关闭银行和公共机构
item.description: 据伊朗国家媒体报道，伊朗本周末下令关闭全国一半地区的公共办公场所，以缓解酷热带来的能源需求。【原文：Iran ordered public offices closed across half the country this weekend to ease energy demand driven by intense heat, state media report.】

item.title: 日本高温将持续一个月，促进电力使用
item.description: 据国家气象预报员说，日本大部分地区的高温还将持续一个月，持续的高温可能会使电力需求持续增加。【原文：High temperatures across much of Japan are set to last for another month, according to the national weather forecaster, with the persistent heat potentially keeping power demand elevated.】

item.title: 在多户住宅的带动下，美国新屋开工率升至五个月高点
item.description: 在两年多来多户住宅建设速度最快的带动下，美国 7 月份的房屋开工率攀升至五个月来的新高。【原文：Housing starts in the US climbed in July to five-month high, led by the fastest pace of multifamily construction in more than two years.】

item.title: 加拿大通胀率降至 1.7%，主要受汽油价格下跌影响
item.description: 加拿大消费价格略有放缓，基本压力普遍减轻。【原文：Canadian consumer prices moderated slightly and underlying pressures broadly eased.】
